SECRET
G.T.5803
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 27th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
The 1st and 3rd Armies attacked this morning on a wide front from the SENSEE to N. of GOUZEAUCOURT. Progress has been made and we have crossed the canal all along the front from HAVRINCOURT to the SENSEE. Our troops are reported to be advancing on BOURLON.
French Front.
The line on the ARGONNE Battle Front was reported to run last night as follows.
American, DANNEVOUX - BOIS DE SEPTSARGES - VANTILLOIS - CIERGES - EPINONVILLE - CHARPENTRY - BAULNY - (latter place?-unconfirmed) through the BOIS D'AFREMONT - BUIARVILLE - SERVON - MELZYCOURT.
One American Corps reports the capture of 3,000 prisoners and about 40 guns.
French battle line CERNAY - ROUVROY - RIPONT - BUTTE DE TAHURE and the tunnel on the railway line North West of it, then 2 kilometres south of SOMME - PY HILL 193, then to the original line south of AUBERIVE. About 3,000 prisoners reported.
Latest reports state attack is progressing favourably this morning.
The total number of prisoners taken yesterday is estimated at 12,0OO.
ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
Nothing further to report.
PALESTINE FRONT.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.l.
27th September, 1918.
Issued at 12.40 p.m.
